p: The Marburg virus virus-like particle (VLP) system, which models a complete, single infectious cycle, has been developed and used to analyze viral transcription and replication, as well as the budding processes [ 26, 27]. In this study, we attempted to visualize MARV NCLSs transport in Huh-7 cells, by using the MARV VLP system and based on the procedure established for EBOV [ 25]. Cells were transfected with the plasmids encoding the VLP components as illustrated in Fig.Â 2a. We employed this VLP-based system in all subsequent experiments in this study.
